alert.note: Alert for North St. Louis (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 2:15PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern St. Louis County through 245 PM CDT... At 215 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over northwestern Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness, or 28 miles north of Ely, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts up to 30 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern St. Louis County, including the following locations... Crooked Lake, Lac la Croix and Lake Agnes. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle.
